div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1772 Urfa (anc. Edessa), Mesopotamia, (1147) 1924 Burial: 185-160 B.C. (Price) Contents: c. 200 AR Alexander III: 28 lifetime and early post. dr. ( Abydus 3, Lampsacus 8, Colophon 7, Magnesia 1, Miletus 1, Teos 2, Sar- des 2, unc. 4) 15 late post. tetradr. ( Hera- cleia Pont. 1, Mytilene 2, Temnus 2, Chios 1, Aspendus 2, Perge 7) 1 dr. ( Chios) Antigonus Gonatas: 5 tetradr. Antigonus Doson: 1 tetradr. Lysimachus: 21 lifetime tetradr. ( Amphi- polis 1, Pella 1, Sestus 1, Abydus 1, Lampsacus 6, Parium ? 1, Alexandreia Troas 2, Magnesia 3, Smyrna 2, Sardes 1, unc. 2) 1 dr. ( Colophon) 8 post. tetradr. ( Lysima- cheia 1, Byzantium 1, Calchedon 2, Cius 1, Tenedos 1, unc. 2) Athens: 1 New Style tetradr. (Thompson 26a) Prusias I: 9 tetradr. Eumenes II: 2 tetradr. Cyme: 1 tetradr. Antiochus I: 7 tetradr. ( Seleuceia ad Ti- grim) Antiochus II: 9 tetradr. ( Seleuceia ad Ti- grim 4, Antiocheia 1, Apameia 2, Tarsus 1, Sardes 1) Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Apameia) Seleucus III: 1 tetradr. (unc. mint) Antiochus III: 55 tetradr. ( Seleuceia ad Tigrim 8, Susa 1, Nisibis? 22, An- tiocheia 9, Apameia 2, Laodiceia 4, Tarsus 3, unc. 6) Disposition: London 77; New York 20; Beirut (American Univ.); Damascus Newell, ESM and WSM, indices of hoards, s.v. Urfa Jenkins, ANSMN 13 (1967), pp. 55-6 Price, NC 1969, pp. 10-4, illus. (the N of the record refers to Newell's list, not to his acquisitions)
